intro: Uragoga thyrsiflora, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree fern, is a species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its large, tree-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant has a stout, fibrous trunk that supports its expansive crown of feathery leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforest understories. Uragoga thyrsiflora plays an important ecological role in Hawaii's native ecosystems.
